channel.title: [C4D] Lamborghini Murcielago
channel.description:
I'm not really a car person but i think its safe to say this turned out halfway decent ;) And im also pretty sure I got the whole 'car piece' thing down pretty good :D
This is mainly just more practice for low poly modeling, although the tires are kinda 80k polys each.... they can easily be replaced with shit in comparison :)
[img]http://fc02.deviantart.com/fs47/f/2009/219/4/a/Lamborghini_Murcielago_3_by_Frell262.png[/img]
The low poly really shows around the wheels though

item.title: [C4D] Lamborghini Murcielago
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Archer, post:16, topic:293464”][quote author=Frell link=topic=388323.msg2913828#msg2913828 date=1250279875]

No NURBs or weighting.

Smoothing and edgeloops.

Weighting is for noobs.

:eek: Forgot all about edge loops Ill give it a shot.

Ehh like i said the car wasn’t made smooth-ready so its already too much of a mess. I don’t mind making another. Practice makes perfect
[/quote]

How could you forget edge loops rofl, best tool ever.[/quote]
Ino right. But i was thinking of that 5 hour lambo tutorial where he used weights

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Lamborghini Murcielago
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:12, topic:293464”]The newest post has improved.

I just walked into some modeling class this morning (the second class, so like 201 or something) to show my friend my car (turns out they were making cars too).

Simply put, all of there cars look like your car. Some, worse. >.<

I can’t wait to take that class and blow them away. Even the teacher was like SICKKKKKKKKK.

What’s yours look like smoothed?[/quote]
Well I’m glad that I’m able to make something better than the people that are in college for it

I really don’t enjoy using nurbs on cars because it can get tricky. But because i modeled it for low poly it wont look very good =\ on all my other cars i would model WITH nurbs on. If i ever get spare time ill try to model the roof down to the hood in nurbs and weight the nurbs as i go along rather than when its finished.

Read full topic

@archerer98 wrote:

Looks weird without mirrors :|.

item.title: [C4D] Lamborghini Murcielago
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:5, topic:293464”]For a low poly car, it’s nice, besides the obvious things like no side mirrors O.o

This could be a start of a nice car though. It almost looks just like my first lambo.[/quote]
Its not completely finished, im still putting in the mirrors Personally i think cars look better without mirrors lol

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:6, topic:293464”]I just think the wheels/rims are ugly.
and the picture itself looks desaturated.[/quote]
Those are the wheels i took from my bike and slapped them on. I already had a tire so why not But they’re just place holders for a low poly wheel which i don’t really need and can be made in a jiffy.

Archer:

Did you work on this for 48 hours straight? You just showed me recently and nothing was done lol. Anyways nice.

No, For me when i re-model something it gets better and better. So I decided to ditch the old model and start another one this time REALLY paying attention to car parts (I also like starting from the roof more than the hood :P) But it still can use some touch ups in some obvious places. I started modeling it around 2ishpm and ended at around 10pm So it was a good 8 hours of nothing but car I’ve done alot of point to point modeling before this.

Read full topic
